title: Robust methods to detect coupling among nonlinear time series
abstract:
Two numerical methods are proposed for detection of coupling between multiple
time series generated by deterministic nonlinear systems. The first detects
interdependence or the existence of coupling between time series. The second
ascertains directionality of coupling, or alternatively, latent coupling, the
case when multiple series are driven by another, unobserved system. In either
case, the driver and the recipients of the coupling may be periodic or
aperiodic, and in particular may be chaotic. The only inputs to the method are
two or more simultaneously recorded time series. The methods rely solely on
ranking distances between states in time-delay reconstructions of the data, and
for that reason tend to be robust to observational noise.
